contentEN: ### What is Web Hosting and Why Is It Important?
If you want to create a website, one of the first steps is to understand what web hosting is. So, what exactly is web hosting and why is it essential for your website? Let's dive into the details.
#### Web Hosting
Web hosting is a service that allows you to publish your website on the internet. Through this service, all the data needed for your website is stored on a special server.
#### Is It Possible to Host a Website on a Personal Computer?
Technically, yes - you can turn your personal laptop or desktop as a server and publish your own website. However, this approach presents several challenges:
- Your computer must remain on 24/7
- You need a strong and stable Internet connection
- You have to handle security, technical support, and data backups yourself
In reality, this method involves many risks and technical difficulties. That's why most users don't choose this route.
To ensure your website is always accessible and fast, the best decision is to work with a reliable web hosting company. These companies offer essential services such as:
- Physical storage (servers)
- 24/7 technical support
- Security and data protection
- Automatic backups
This way, you can focus on managing and developing your website's content instead of dealing with technical issues.

Without a web hosting service, it's not possible to publish a website online. If you aim to build a professional and always-active website, choosing a trustworthy web hosting provider should be your first step.
**Remember:** Hosting is your website's home, and the domain is its address!

titleEN: How can artificial intelligence affect websites?
titleAZ: Süni intellekt vebsaytlara necə təsir edə bilər?
contentEN: #### Man, AI is moving fast—like, blink and you’ll miss it.

- It’s not just about robots taking over the world (yet), it’s actually making websites smarter and, honestly, way more personal than ever before. So let’s dig into how this tech is flipping the script on web design.
#### First off, personalization is where AI really flexes.

- It’s like your favorite barista who remembers your weirdly specific coffee order. AI watches what you do, what you click, what you ignore, and then—bam!—the site throws stuff you’ll probably love right in your face. Think Spotify’s “Discover Weekly,” but on every site. Product recs, custom search results, even the articles you see—it’s all tailored to you, whether you like it or not.
#### Now, predictive analytics sounds super nerdy, but stick with me.

- Basically, AI’s out here playing psychic, guessing what you’ll want before you even know you want it. It chews through piles of your data and then, somehow, it’s like, “Hey, you’re probably gonna want this next.” Creepy? Maybe. Useful? Absolutely.
#### And get this—real-time optimization.

- If you ditch your shopping cart (we’ve all done it), AI notices and jumps in. Suddenly, there’s a pop-up offering you a discount or showing you similar stuff. It’s like the website’s begging you to stick around. Kind of flattering, really.
#### Oh, and those chatbots popping up everywhere?

- They’re not just annoying pop-ups anymore. These AI-powered virtual assistants are actually getting good. They can answer your questions, point you to the right page, and sometimes even crack a joke—well, a robot joke, but still.

titleEN: Earn the trust of your customers with your website.
contentEN: Alright, let's get real—nobody’s sticking around on a sketchy-looking website. It’s like walking into a store with flickering lights and weird stains on the carpet. Online, your site is your handshake. So, if you want people to trust you (and actually buy something), you gotta make that first impression count.
#### 1.First off: looks matter.

- I mean, would you trust a site that looks like it time-traveled from 1999? Didn’t think so. Get yourself a clean, sharp design with colors that actually match your brand. Don’t overdo the bells and whistles, but don’t make it look like you gave up halfway through, either.
#### 2.Navigation—oh boy, don’t make me work for it.

- If I’m hunting for the checkout button like it’s buried treasure, I’m out. Headings should actually mean something, and menus should be obvious. And hey, if your site’s a nightmare on mobile, you’re basically telling half your customers to get lost.
#### 3.Now, reviews? Gold.
- People trust other people more than they trust you. Slap those five-star reviews right where everyone can see ‘em. And don’t hide the bad ones—if you fix problems, show it. Makes you look real.

- Trust badges and certifications—yeah, those little “Verified” icons and SSL locks? They actually mean something. If you’ve got ‘em, flaunt ‘em. Not in a desperate way, just enough so I know you’re not running a scam out of your mom’s basement.
#### 4.Contact info: Don’t make me play detective.
- Put your phone, email, even your address (if you’ve got one) somewhere obvious. If it feels like you’re hiding, I’m bouncing.
#### 5.Oh, and payment stuff—don’t mess around.
- Make it super clear you’re using secure payments, or people will abandon their carts faster than you can say “credit card fraud.”
#### 6.Bottom line?
- If your website looks legit, is easy to use, and gives off “real business” vibes, you’re already halfway to winning people over. Don’t overthink it—just don’t be a sketchball.

titleEN: 5 web design tips to rank first in search engines
titleAZ: Axtarış motorlarında ilk sırada çıxmaq üçün 5 veb dizayn tövsiyəsi
contentEN: Alright, let’s get real about web design and SEO. You want your site to show up on Google, right? Well, design is kinda like the secret sauce that search engines actually care about. Here’s how not to mess it up:
#### First off, your site’s gotta be responsive.

- No one wants to pinch and zoom on their phone like it’s 2012. Google loves when your page just works on any device—laptop, tablet, phone, even that weird smart fridge screen maybe. If your site’s not mobile-friendly, you’re basically invisible.
#### Next up: images.

- People go nuts with giant photos, but all those huge files? Yeah, they’re killing your load speed and tanking your SEO. Shrink those images down, slap on some alt text (so Google knows what’s in 'em), and keep things snappy.
#### Let’s talk code.

- If your website’s code looks like a spaghetti dinner, search engines are gonna bounce. Clean it up. No extra junk, no wild experiments with languages that slow everything down. Think of it like tidying your room before your mom barges in.
#### Then, keywords.

- You need ‘em, but don’t just stuff ‘em everywhere like you’re writing a spam email. Put them in smart spots—like your URLs, headers, and stuff. That way, Google gets what your site’s about without thinking you’re a robot.
#### Internal links—people sleep on this, but it’s actually huge.
- Link your pages together so search engines can crawl your site like a curious little spider. It helps everyone (humans and robots) figure out where stuff is.

Honestly, you can have the fanciest design in the world, but if your content is trash or your site’s a pain to use, you’re gonna get smoked in the rankings anyway. So yeah, make it pretty, make it smart, and above all, make it useful. Google (and real people) will thank you.

titleEN: 5 free sites where you can send bulk emails to your customers
titleAZ: Müştərilərinə toplu email göndərə biləcəyin 5 pulsuz sayt
contentEN: Alright, listen up—email marketing isn’t just some dusty business buzzword. If you wanna keep your customers in the loop (and, let’s be honest, occasionally shove your latest sale in their faces), bulk emailing is your bread and butter. But yeah, sending out a mountain of emails by hand? No thanks. That’s why these free platforms are absolute lifesavers. Here are five spots where you can blast out emails to your people—without emptying your wallet.
#### 1.Sendinblue

- This one’s a crowd favorite. You get unlimited contacts and can send up to 300 emails a day, all for the sweet price of zero dollars. They throw in automation, A/B testing, and a dashboard to geek out over your stats. Plus, the emails actually look good—no 90s newsletter vibes here.
#### 2.Mailchimp

- You know that monkey logo? That’s Mailchimp. Their free plan lets you send 10,000 emails a month to 2,000 subscribers. Templates? Got those. Analytics? Yup. It’s basically the Ikea of email marketing—everything you need to put together a campaign without losing your mind.
#### 3.SendPulse

- SendPulse goes a bit overboard—in a good way. You can fire off 15,000 emails a month (no, that’s not a typo) to 500 subscribers. It’s not just email either—they love a good multichannel hustle. Perfect if you’re all about getting your messages out everywhere, all at once.
#### 4.Moosend

- Weird name, solid product. Moosend lets you have up to 1,000 subscribers and unlimited emails on the free plan. Automation’s there, landing pages, and you can track results in real time. Super simple to use. Honestly, you could teach your grandma to send a campaign with this thing.
#### 5.Benchmark Email

- Last but not least, Benchmark gives you 2,000 subscribers and 14,000 emails a month for free. They keep things straightforward with templates, list management, and reports. Great if you want to keep it chill and not get lost in a maze of features.

titleEN: How can you make your site mobile-friendly?
titleAZ: Saytınızı mobil istifadəçilər üçün necə uyğun edə bilərsiniz?
contentEN: Look, everyone’s glued to their phones these days. If your website still looks like it’s from the dial-up era on mobile, you’re basically waving goodbye to half your visitors. So yeah, you gotta get your site mobile-ready. Here’s how I’d tackle it:
#### 1.First off, go with a responsive design:

- Don’t overthink it—just make sure your site morphs to fit whatever screen it lands on. Tablet, giant phone, or something in between? Your site should still look sharp, not like a jigsaw puzzle missing half the pieces.
#### 2.Seriously, keep it simple.

- Mobile users aren’t out here reading War and Peace on their screens. Ditch the junk. Blow up your fonts, make your buttons big enough for normal human fingers, and focus on the stuff that actually matters.
#### 3.Oh, and your images?
- Nobody’s waiting around for a wallpaper-sized photo to load. Compress those bad boys. Smaller size, same quality—that’s the dream.
#### 4.Forms
- Nobody likes them, especially on a phone. So knock it down to the bare essentials. Only ask what you really need, make the fields big, and don’t be that guy with the 20-question survey.
#### 5.Speed is everything
- If your site drags its feet, people bounce. Period. Trim the fat—videos, mega-images, whatever’s slowing things down. Mobile users are impatient (honestly, who isn’t these days?).

Last thing: actually check your site on different devices. Don’t just hope it works. Borrow your friend’s phone, steal your grandma’s tablet (well, maybe not steal), and see how your masterpiece holds up. Do all that, and you’re way ahead of most folks out there.

#### 5. Saytınızın sürətli olmasını təmin edin:

- Mobil istifadəçilər çox vaxtda yolda olduqları üçün yavaş yüklənən saytlara qarşı səbrləri çatmaya bilər. Saytınızın sürətini ləngidə biləcək böyük şəkillər, videolar və digər ağır həcmli kontentin istifadəsini minimuma endirməklə saytınızın sürətini optimallaşdırın.
#### 6. Saytınızı müxtəlif cihazlarda sınayın:

titleEN: Increase your customers with the right website design
titleAZ: Düzgün sayt dizaynı ilə müştərilərinizi artırın
contentEN: Alright, let’s cut the fluff and get real—your website is basically your brand’s Tinder profile. Folks are gonna swipe left if it looks sketchy or takes forever to load. So, let’s talk about how to make your digital front porch actually inviting (and not a haunted house).
#### 1.First off, don’t be mysterious.

- People don’t have time for that. Slap your value prop right up front—who you are, what you actually do, and why you’re cooler than the competition. Don’t bury it under five paragraphs of marketing jargon. Honestly, nobody’s got the patience to go on a treasure hunt.
#### 2.Next, visuals.

- Please, no pixelated product pics or weird stock photos of people high-fiving in suits. Use sharp, high-quality images and videos that actually show off your stuff. If you can make me want to reach through the screen and grab your product, you’re winning.
#### 3.Speed matters.

- If your website loads slower than a dial-up connection in 1998, forget it. People bounce. Shrink those images, get some caching going, and don’t let bloated code drag you down. Basically, make it snappy.
#### 4.Navigation.
- Keep menus simple, clear, and obvious. The less thinking visitors have to do, the more likely they’ll stick around and maybe even buy something.
#### 5.Social proof? It’s not just for Amazon.
- Slap up real customer reviews, not just the “John D.” with the generic five stars. Let your happy customers do the selling for you—nothing builds trust faster.

- Don’t forget those Calls to Action! Make ‘em bold, make ‘em obvious, and for the love of all things digital, don’t be shy. Whether you want folks to buy, sign up, or just stalk you on Instagram, spell it out.
#### 6.Bottom line:

- A slick, speedy, and trustworthy website is your ticket to more customers. You want people to feel confident clicking that ‘Buy Now’ or ‘Sign Up’—not like they’re taking a leap of faith. So, polish that site up and watch your sales climb. No rocket science required.

titleEN: 5 email marketing ideas that will increase your sales
contentEN: Aparılan sorğular göstərir ki, insanların çox böyük bir hissəsi hər gün öz maillərini yoxlayır. Bu da o deməkdir ki, insanlara mail vasitəsilə marketinq strategiyası tətbiq etmək düşünüləndən daha da effektiv təsirlər göstərə bilər. Bu yazıda isə uğurlu e-mail marketinqi üçün tətbiq edə biləcəyiniz bir neçə strategiyanı sizinlə bölüşürük.
#### 1.Mailləri daha şəxsi formaya salın

- Müştərilərinizə mail yazarkən onlara adları ilə xitab etmək onların diqqətini çəkmək üçün ən yaxşı üsullardan biridir. İnsanlar hətta avtomatik göndərilən maillərdə belə öz adlarını görməyi sevirlər, çünki bu onların özlərini daha dəyərli hiss etməsinə səbəb olur. Bundan əlavə müştərilərinizi müəyyən seqmentlərə bölsəniz, hər bir müştəri üçün daha da şəxsi formaya salınmış maillər göndərmək imkanınız olacaq.
#### 2.Vizual olaraq daha aktiv maillər işlədin

- İnsanların diqqətini çəkməsi üçün mətnlərdən daha çox vizuallığa, yəni maildə işlədilən şəkillərə, mailin ümumi dizaynı kimi detallara önəm vermək lazımdır. Həmçinin mətnlərdə müxtəlif yazı formatlarından istifadə etmək də oxucunun maili oxumağa davam etməsi üçün ideal üsul hesab olunur. Lakin unutmayın ki, həddən artıq vizuallıq həm mailin yüklənmə sürətini aşağa salacaq, həm də maili oxuyanı daha çox yorduğu üçün effektivliyi də azalmış olacaq.
#### 3.Aktiv olmayan istifadəçilərə xüsusi təkliflər edin

- Yeni istifadəçilər qazanmaqdan əlavə köhnə istifadəçilərinizin də mövcudluğunu unutmamalısınız. Xüsusilə aktiv olmayan abunəçilərinizin diqqətini çəkmək üçün onları yenidən aktiv olmağa dəvət edə, onlara xüsusi endirim kampaniyaları təklif edə bilərsiniz. Həmçinin aktiv olmayan istifadəçiləriniz üçün sorğu keçirərək də öz xidmətlərinizi yaxşılaşdırmaq imkanından istifadə edə bilərsiniz.
#### 4.Emosiyalardan istifadə edin

- Şirkətinizin göstərdiyi xidmət sahəsindən asılı olaraq öz müştərilərinizin hiss və emosiyalarına müraciət edərək onların diqqətini çəkə bilərsiniz. Emosiyalardan istifadə etmək müştərilərlə aranızdakı əlaqəni yaxşılaşdıracaq və sizi özlərinə qarşı daha səmimi bir şirkət kimi görəcəklər. Mail marketinqi xüsusilə emosiyalar üzərindən strategiya qurmaq üçün çox əlverişlidir.
#### 5.Qısa maillərə üstünlük verin

- Uzun mətnli maillər yazmaq oxuyucunun sıxılmasına və sona qədər bitmədən maildən çıxmasına səbəb ola bilər. Ona görə də maillərinizdə fikirlərinizi qısa və konkret şəkildə çatdırmaq uğurlu marketinq strategiyası üçün çox önəmlidir. Həmçinin cümlələri bir neçə abzasa bölmək və siyahılardan istifadə etmək də mətnin daha axıcı olmasına kömək edən amillərdəndir.
contentAZ: Surveys show that a large proportion of people check their emails every day. This means that marketing to people through email can have a more effective impact than you think. In this article, we share with you several strategies that you can apply for successful email marketing.
#### 1. Make emails more personal

- Addressing your customers by their name when writing emails is one of the best ways to grab their attention. People like to see their names, even in automated emails, because it makes them feel more valued. In addition, if you divide your customers into certain segments, you will have the opportunity to send emails that are more personalized for each customer.
#### 2. Use more visually active emails

- To attract people's attention, you need to pay more attention to visuals, that is, to the images used in the email, to details such as the overall design of the email. Also, using different writing formats in the texts is considered an ideal way to keep the reader reading the email. However, remember that too much visuals will slow down the loading speed of the email and make it more tiring for the reader, so its effectiveness will decrease.
#### 3. Make special offers to inactive users

- In addition to gaining new users, you should also remember the existence of your old users. In particular, to attract the attention of your inactive subscribers, you can invite them to become active again and offer them special discount campaigns. You can also use the opportunity to improve your services by conducting surveys for your inactive users.
#### 4. Use emotions

- Depending on the field of service your company provides, you can attract the attention of your customers by appealing to their feelings and emotions. Using emotions will improve the relationship between you and your customers and they will see you as a more sincere company towards them. Email marketing is especially suitable for building a strategy based on emotions.
#### 5. Prefer short emails

- Writing long text emails can cause the reader to get bored and leave the email before finishing it. That's why keeping your ideas concise and specific in your emails is essential to a successful marketing strategy. Breaking sentences into multiple paragraphs and using lists can also help make your text more fluid.

titleEN: 4 Benefits of Corporate Social Responsibility for Your Business
titleAZ: Korporativ Sosial Məsuliyyətin biznesinizə qazandıracağı 4 üstünlük
contentEN: Alright, let’s tear down that corporate-speak and give it a real-world punch. So, corporate social responsibility—CSR for short—that’s just a fancy way of saying companies should give a damn about more than just their bank accounts, right? At the most basic level, it means paying taxes (yeah, shocking, I know), treating employees like actual humans, and not trashing the planet just to make a buck. But if you’re really playing the long game, CSR goes way beyond the bare minimum. It’s about actually doing stuff that makes society better, not just ticking boxes. Now, these days, CSR isn’t just a nice-to-have. It’s basically survival mode for businesses. People are watching. You mess up, and the internet will drag you before you even finish your morning coffee. But hey, if you get it right? The perks are pretty sweet. Let me hit you with four reasons why CSR is honestly a game-changer for any company that isn’t living in the Stone Age.
#### 1. Your brand starts looking awesome

- People aren’t blind. They see who’s polluting rivers and who’s actually giving back. Customers care about what kind of impact your products have—on people, on the planet, all of it. You show folks you’ve got a moral compass, and suddenly, you’re the cool kid at the business lunch. Your brand goes from “meh” to “must-have.”
#### 2. Talented folks wanna work for you

- You know Gen Z isn’t gonna spend their lives grinding away for some soulless mega-corp, right? They want to work somewhere that means something. If you’re out here showing off your CSR cred, you’re gonna have the best resumes landing on your desk. It’s like talent magnetism.
#### 3. You save money (no, really)

- CSR isn’t just a feel-good thing. Turns out, being smart about waste and energy puts more cash in your pocket. LED bulbs, recycling, less junk in the landfill—suddenly your bills shrink and your accountant stops stress-eating. Everybody wins.
#### 4. Customers stick around

- People remember when you do good. They’re way more likely to keep buying from you if you share their values and don’t, you know, secretly dump chemicals in a river. You build trust, and trust means repeat business. Simple as that.

Oh, and want a real-world example? Check out bacararsan.az. It’s a project close to my heart—basically a bunch of online workshops and pep talks for young folks with physical disabilities who want to get into web programming. They learn the ropes, figure out how to make money online, and pick up all sorts of practical skills—no need to even leave the house. It’s the kind of thing that actually changes lives, not just some hollow PR stunt. Bottom line? CSR isn’t just about looking good. It’s about doing good, and—bonus!—you might even make more money while you’re at it. Not a bad deal, huh?
contentAZ: Korporativ sosial məsuliyyət  şirkət və quruluşların cəmiyyətə qarşı olan məsuliyyətlərinin məcmuəsidir. Korporativ sosial məsuliyyət (KSM) bütün ölçülərdə olan bizneslər üçün getdikcə daha vacib bir məsələyə çevrilmişdir. KSM-yə proaktiv yanaşma ilə şirkətlər nəinki cəmiyyətə müsbət təsir göstərə, həm də öz mənfəətləri üçün bir sıra faydalar əldə edə bilərlər. Güclü KSM strategiyasını qəbul etməklə siz etik dəyərlərə öz sadiqliyinizi nümayiş etdirə bilərsiniz. Bu brend reputasiyanızı artıra və sizi məsuliyyətli bizneslərə üstünlük verən istehlakçılar üçün daha cəlbedici edə bilər.
#### 2. İstedadlı kadrları şirkətinizə cəlb edir.

Xüsusilə gənclər sosial və ekoloji məsuliyyətə üstünlük verən şirkətlərdə işləməyə getdikcə daha çox maraq göstərirlər. KSM-yə sadiqliyinizi nümayiş etdirməklə, özünüzü rəqiblərdən fərqləndirə və ən yaxşı və ən parlaq işçiləri cəlb edə bilərsiniz.
#### 3. Xərcləri azaldır:

- KSM strategiyasını qəbul etmək uzun müddətdə xərcləri azaltmağa kömək edə bilər. Məsələn, enerjiyə qənaət edən avadanlıqlara investisiya qoymaq və ya tullantıları azaltmaq kommunal ödənişlərin və tullantıların utilizasiyası xərclərinin azalmasına səbəb olur. Bu, gəlirliliyinizi artırmağa və biznesinizi bazarda daha rəqabətli etməyə kömək edə bilər.
#### 4. Müştəri sadiqliyini artırır:

- Güclü KSM strategiyası müştərilərinizlə daha güclü əlaqələr qurmağınıza kömək edur. Sosial və ekoloji məsuliyyətə sadiqliyinizi nümayiş etdirməklə siz müştərilərinizə onların dəyərlərini paylaşdığınızı və dünyaya müsbət təsir göstərmək üçün çalışdığınızı göstərirsiniz.

Belə ki, gənclər global freelancer platformaları ilə tanış olur, insanların evdən çıxmadan necə proqramlaşdırmaya yiyələndiyi, həmin bilikləri sayəsində müvafiq platformalarda nə cür xidmət sataraq gəlir əldə etdiyi, nağdsız ödənişlərin qəbul olunması və xərclənməsi kimi innovativ təməl biliklərə sahib olurlar.

titleEN: What is the use of 'call to action' on websites?
titleAZ: Vebsaytlarda 'call to action' nə işə yarayır?
contentEN: Let’s be real: a “Call to Action” (or CTA, because who has time for long phrases?) is basically the little nudge that turns a random browser into an actual customer, follower, or whatever you’re after. Think buttons screaming “BUY NOW,” links that promise more, or messages that guilt-trip you into subscribing. If you’ve ever bought something you didn’t need at 2AM, blame a good CTA.

Honestly, if you’re building a website and ignoring CTAs, what are you even doing? They’re the bread and butter of online business—like, if your page is a sandwich, the CTA is the secret sauce that makes people come back for more. So, yeah, let’s talk about how to make those suckers actually work.
#### 1.First off, don’t write a novel.

Keep it short. Like, really short. Nobody wants to read a paragraph on a button. “Get Started,” “Grab Yours,” “Join Free”—you get the idea. If you need a dictionary to understand your own CTA, start over.
#### 2.Visibility’s key.
If I have to go on a scavenger hunt to find your CTA, forget it. Make it pop—use colors that slap, fat buttons, and bold words. It’s not the time to be shy.
#### 3.Urgency is your friend.
People are lazy and indecisive, so give them a reason to move their butt. “Sale ends tonight!” or “Only 3 left”—that’s the stuff. FOMO is real, play into it.
#### 4.And please, tell people what’s in it for them.
“Sign up for a free e-book” is way better than a sad little “Sign up.” Give ‘em a reason to care.
#### 5.Last thing

Don’t just slap a CTA up and hope for the best. Test it. Change up the words, colors, button size—heck, even the font. See what actually gets people clicking. Because, in the end, nobody really knows what’ll work until you try it.
So, yeah, CTAs—don’t sleep on ‘em.

#### 3. Təcililik hissi yaradın:

- İstifadəçiləri hərəkətə keçməyə sövq etmək üçün CTA-nız məhdud zamanlı təklifi və ya məhdud sayda mövcud məhsulları vurğulamaqla təcililik hissi yaratmalıdır. Təcililik hissi yaratmaq üçün 'indi hərəkət et' və ya 'son 10 saat' kimi ifadələrdən də istifadə edə bilərsiniz.

#### 5. Sınaqdan keçirin və optimallaşdırın:

You can mix your own background noise—rain, thunder, waves, even coffee shop chatter if you’re feeling fancy. It’s like building your own little world to vibe in. Pretty soothing, honestly.

- This one is for the nerds, the stargazers, anyone who’s ever looked up and thought, “Dang, we’re tiny.” Scale of Universe lets you zoom from the size of an atom all the way up to actual galaxies. - Ever get bored of your usual playlists? Gnoosic is like that friend who just *gets* your music taste and always knows what to play next. Toss in a couple of your favorite artists, and bam—it serves up new tunes you’ll probably love. No more endless scrolling through Spotify’s “Recommended for You” section.

- Wanna travel but your wallet’s saying “lol, no”? The Secret Door is perfect. Click it, and you’re instantly dropped somewhere random on Google Street View. Could be a bustling market in Tokyo, could be a lonely road in Iceland. It’s pure, delightful chaos.

- This one’s just cool. Radiooooo lets you pick a country and a decade, and then fills your ears with music from that place and time. You want French jazz from the ‘40s? Or Brazilian pop from the ‘80s? It’s a musical time machine, and honestly, it’s addictive.

titleEN: 5 reasons to use Google Sheets in your business
titleAZ: Biznesinizdə 'Google Sheets' istifadə etməyiniz üçün 5 səbəb
contentEN: The average employee spends up to eight hours a week, or an entire workday, searching for and combining data. What if employees could spend their time using data instead of searching for it?
Google Sheets is a fast and easy way to collect and work with information in one place. In this article, we’ll share with you the benefits of using Google Sheets.
#### Your stuff just updates itself, like magic.

Honestly, Google Sheets is always saving your data, so you don’t have to stress about losing anything if your cat jumps on the keyboard or your Wi-Fi decides to take a nap. Everyone on your team can poke around the same project, whether they’re on their phone at Starbucks, their laptop in bed, or even offline (yep, it actually works). It keeps everyone looking at the same page—literally.
#### Want to tweak things your way?
- Go wild. You can sort, filter, hide sheets you don’t care about, and nobody’s gonna mess up what you see. You see your stuff, they see theirs. No accidental sabotage.
#### And the whole AI thing?

- Google Sheets has its own little robot wizard living inside. It’ll spit out charts, suggest formulas, whip up tables—basically, it’s your nerdy sidekick for data crunching. Sometimes it even guesses what you want before you know it. Creepy, but helpful.

Security? Relax. You control who can peek or poke around in your spreadsheets, so your top-secret pizza ranking list stays safe. Tons of privacy options, so your data isn’t just floating around for every rando to see.

Automation? That’s a breeze. Since your data’s all hanging out in one place, you can hook up Sheets with Docs, Slides, Forms—whatever. Like, you run a survey in Forms and, bam, all those answers show up in Sheets. No more copying and pasting until your eyes bleed.

And, hey, if you’re just tossing in simple stuff, Sheets will handle it without breaking a sweat. But if you wanna get fancy—formatting, formulas, the whole shebang—it’s got your back. No math degree required.

titleEN: 5 key factors that make it mandatory for you to have a corporate email
titleAZ: Korporativ e-mailə sahib olmağınızı məcburiyyətə çevirən 5 əsas amil
contentEN: In today’s business world, a large part of job interviews and corporate communications take place via emails. This, in turn, increases the importance of emails, making them one of the key elements of a company. It’s no surprise that many large companies prefer to use corporate email addresses to make their business operations more efficient and improve work relationships. But how important is it really to have a corporate email? In this article, we present the main advantages that corporate email addresses provide for any business.
Real Talk: Why You Need a Proper Business Email Address
#### First Impressions Are Everything, Right?

- Let’s be real—nobody wants to do business with “cooldude1995@gmail.com.” You show up in someone’s inbox with a random Gmail or, God forbid, a Hotmail, and instantly you look like you’re selling stuff out of your garage. A slick corporate email, though? Instantly, you look like you know what you’re doing. People trust it. Partners, customers, whoever. It’s like showing up to a meeting in a sharp suit instead of pajama pants.
#### Customers Aren’t Stupid

- People aren’t just tossing their hard-earned cash at whoever emails them first. If you’re out here hitting up customers with a freebie email address, honestly, you look sketchy. There’s just something about seeing a proper business domain at the end of an email that makes people breathe a little easier. They’ll actually reply instead of moving you straight to spam. Plus, if your competitor looks more legit, guess who gets the sale? (Not you.)
#### Marketing Emails That Actually Get Read

- Let’s talk email marketing for a sec. You could spend hours crafting the perfect promo, but if it comes from “yourcompany@gmail.com,” most people won’t even open it, or worse, it goes straight to the spam folder. Having a real business email boosts your open rate because people actually believe it’s from you, not some scammer in a basement somewhere. That’s just reality.
#### Keep Your Business Safe (And Your Butt Covered)

- Cyberattacks are everywhere these days. Hackers love a weak target, and personal email accounts are like leaving your front door wide open. Corporate email systems? Way more secure. You get backups, so when someone accidentally deletes that super important message (it happens, trust me), you’re not totally screwed. Plus, your clients’ info stays locked down, which means fewer headaches if something goes wrong.
- Communication That Doesn’t Suck

- Ever tried to figure out which John in your company sent that email from “johnnyboy123@yahoo.com”? Nightmare. When everyone’s using the same domain—like “john@yourcompany.com”—it’s a million times easier to keep track of who’s who. Customers know exactly who to reach, and your team isn’t playing email detective all day. Simple, clean, and way less confusing.

titleEN: 5 free resources to build a website without coding
contentEN: You've probably experienced how important websites are in the modern business world. Especially during the pandemic, with the rise of online services, the importance of websites has become even more apparent. Although creating a website is often thought of as a complicated process, there are many sites today that will help you create a website without requiring any coding knowledge. In this article, we will introduce you to 5 free resources that will help you create a website without writing any code.
### Wix
#### Stuff to love

- They've got, like, a zillion templates—seriously, over 900. Whatever your vibe, there's probably something that fits. Wanna build more than one site? Go wild, Wix lets you. The design tools are pretty slick, too. Oh, and your site actually looks decent on phones without you having to pull your hair out. Tons of images to play with, if you’re into that.
#### Stuff that sucks

- Once you pick a template, you’re married to it. No switching later, so choose wisely. Also, there are so many dang features, a newbie might just get lost in the sauce. And the free plan? They throw you a measly 500MB of storage. That’s, what, like three cat videos?
### Webflow
#### Perks

- SEO nerds, this one’s for you—tons of tools to play with. They hand you 10GB of storage right out the gate. Plus, if you’re the artsy type, you can build your site from scratch. No cookie-cutter nonsense.
#### Downsides

- The whole thing kinda feels like you accidentally opened Photoshop instead of a website builder. Designers might dig it, but if you don’t know your way around Adobe stuff, you might just stare at the screen and cry a little.
### WordPress
#### Why it rocks

- If you wanna run a blog, WordPress is basically the GOAT. Make as many websites as your heart desires, no one’s stopping you. You can buy your domain right there, which is handy. The interface? Super chill, nothing scary.
#### Why it doesn’t
- E-commerce? Eh, not its strong suit. And let's be real, security is a bit sketchy sometimes. Hackers love the place.
### Jimdo
#### What’s cool

- You can bang out a website in, like, five minutes. Their mobile app means you can edit on the toilet (don’t act like you haven’t). Wanna get your hands dirty with code? HTML’s on the table. Adding pics and vids? Easy as pie.
#### What’s not
- Blogging here is like doing your taxes—way too complicated. Plus, the free version is pretty limited, so don’t expect miracles.
### Weebly
#### The good stuff

- Templates look sharp, like, “did a pro do this?” level. You can slap videos in the background and make things pop. If you like editing on your phone, there’s an app for that. Autosave means your stuff won’t vanish when your laptop dies.
#### The not-so-good
- SEO kinda sucks here. Sometimes the platform just... freezes? Like, really? And you only get 500MB of storage on the free plan, so don’t get too ambitious.
